__TOC__

<nowiki>[[http://www.procmail.org|Procmail]]</nowiki> is a versatile e-mail processor that can be used to sort your incoming mail.  You configure it by creating a `~/.procmailrc` file.  It's described by some rather complicated manpages, so people have put together:

* a <nowiki>[[http://www.ii.com/internet/robots/procmail/qs/|quick start guide]]</nowiki>
* a <nowiki>[[http://lipas.uwasa.fi/~ts/info/proctips.html|cookbook]]</nowiki>
* a <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Bugs/HowToFilter|How to filter guide]]</nowiki>

=== Sample ===

Here is a sample `~/.procmailrc` file that you can use to weed out duplicate mail and throw away extra mail from <nowiki>[[http://lists.ubuntu.com/mailman/listinfo/ubuntu-bugs|ubuntu-bugs]]</nowiki>.

<pre>
VERBOSE=yes

INBOX=$MAIL

PMDIR=$HOME/procmail

:0 Wh: .msgid.lock
| formail -D 8192 $PMDIR/.msgid.cache

:0
* ^TO_ubuntu-bugs@lists\.ubuntu\.com
* ^X-Launchpad-Bug:
{
  :0 B
** ^Public bug reported:
  $INBOX
  :0
  /dev/null
}

:0
$INBOX
</pre>
